newsitem.title: INDIA: India Infosys falls 10 pct on BSE.
newsitem.headline: India Infosys falls 10 pct on BSE.

text.p: India's Infosys Technologies Ltd shares tumbled 216.50 rupees, or 10 percent, to 1,950.0 at the Bombay Stock Exchange on Monday amid market talk that holdings held by foreign institutional investors (FIIs) may have reached the ceiling, dealers said.
According to government regulations, foreign portfolio purchases in Indian stocks are limited to 30 percent.
"Expectations of the stock hitting the FII limit is pushing the prices down," said a dealer at a foreign brokerage.
Over 6,700 Infosys shares were traded by early afternoon.
At the National Stock Exchange, Infosys shares were down 165.80 rupees, or seven percent, at 2,243.20 with only 600 shares changing hands.
